newsitem.title: USA: FOB Gulf Grain- Soy and corn nearby offers drop.
newsitem.headline: FOB Gulf Grain- Soy and corn nearby offers drop.

text.p: U.S. FOB Gulf corn and soybean offers dropped in the nearby positions of July and August on Friday while hard red winter wheat values rose, dealers said.
Dealers cited very few farm sales of corn and wheat, and they said export activity was quiet.

FOB values so far showed little reaction to the closure of the mouth of the Mississippi River to commercial shipping traffic on Friday as Hurricane Danny swept across coastal Louisiana, one dealer said.
CORN (No. 3 yellow, FOB, U.S. Gulf, basis CBOT, cts/bu) -
July unq + U unc +25.5 + U dn 1.5
-------- -------- Note: U=CBOT Sept, Z=CBOT Dec, nc=no comparison.
SOYBEANS (No. 2 yellow, FOB, U.S. Gulf, basis CBOT, cts/bu)
LH July unq nc +50 + Q dn 1
--- Note: Q=CBOT August, X=CBOT November, nc=no comparison
SRW WHEAT (FOB, U.S. Gulf, basis CBOT, cts/bu) -
HRW WHEAT (FOB, U.S. Gulf, basis KCBT, cts/bu) - July unq nc +40 + U up 4
